intro: Dombeya suarezensis, commonly known as the Suarezensis Dombeya, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas and is often found in montane forests. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species in horticulture.
